Task: what is unique about Ethiopia calendar? based on this link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethiopian_calendar
Result:

output: The Ethiopian calendar is unique in that it follows the ancient Coptic calendar, which is based on the Egyptian calendar. One of the main differences is that the Ethiopian calendar has 13 months, with 12 months having 30 days each and a 13th month called Pagumē having 5 or 6 days (depending on whether it's a leap year). This results in the Ethiopian calendar being roughly 7-8 years behind the Gregorian calendar. Additionally, the Ethiopian New Year falls on September 11 or 12 (depending on whether it's a leap year), which is different from the January 1st New Year in the Gregorian calendar.\n\nSource: [Wikipedia - Ethiopian calendar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethiopian_calendar)
